1.content:
Excruciating is the only word you can think to describe it. Indescribably insidious sensations contradict the soft security of your exposed socks with each stride against the unforgiving asphalt. The early afternoon sun attempts to boil your inner organs, as well as drown your outer organ in its own sweat. Oxygen stalls its journey to your lungs in an effort to prolong your suffering. You haven't stopped for a mile and a half.

The city is silent, but something is off. Countless people bombard the streets with chaotic actions. Cars meld themselves together with imperfect ripples. Broken glass and rubble line the sidewalks. There should be sound. Perhaps your senses are beginning to shut down.

A deafening rumble shatters the silence. You are unable to keep your momentum, but you stay on your feet. A mere 80 yards away, a massive bare foot is implanted deeply into the street. You wonder if it's her, then wish you could slap yourself for asking such a foolish question.

Well, you might as well make sure. Yup, there's no mistaking it. That baskingly golden tan. Those slender, smooth, endless legs complimented brilliantly by those cut off jean shorts she's always wearing. That firm, tight backside. That flat stomach serving as a plateau for her well rounded bussoms. That beautifully wavy shoulder-blade length brown hair. Those ocean blue eyes and petite nose and mouth. No doubt about it: It's Lauraine.

Every other person on this particular block seems to have made the unanimous decision to run in the direction opposite Lauraine. You have to admit that the sight of a 135 foot tall woman makes you think they may be on to something. No, you have to keep on. After all...
1.title: All is quiet in the city...

choices: She detects him.
He comes back.
Back to you(POV0
Stay with her.
11.content:
You are her boyfriend and she was lonely. She had come to visit you in the city despite you telling her that people would not accept her for who she was but condemn based on her physical appearance. She had not listenened and had grown lonely after you last visit almost a year ago.

You stop and ponder whether running away from your giantess girlfriend is the best solution to this problem. She loved and destroying a city was not her fault. She had done it out of self-defense. The people had started and she as with all living things, fight when their existence is threatened.

Lauraine sat down, her body causing minor tremors as the full weight of it came down. So many hours of searching and yet her boyfriend wasn't found. She began to wonder if she was even in the wrong place.
11.title: You are her boy friend.

111.content:
Lauraine thought all was lost when she spotted her tiny boyfrined in the crowd. Finally, she thought. " Johnny!" she said. She saw him turn around and stand still as she came towards. Extending her palm, he climbed in.


You sit in her palm, she smiling at having found you after a long search. She wasn;t hurt physically. No weapon available to humans could kill her. Unless you njuked her, but that didn't guarentee her death.

" Why were you running from me?' she asked, you can see tears beginning to well up in her tears. " Well...um...um..." you try to come up with a reason to explain that when she breaks down, crying. " You think I'm a freak don't you? Did what happened years ago count for nothing." said Lauraine, tears running down her cheeks.


" No, no, its not like that. I love you , its just that I told you not to come but you didn't listen so I thought I shouldn't come to you but when I saw what they did, I came back." said Johnny.

' Really? I guess you right little guy, I should have stayed at home, away from the city." said Laurainre, she had stopped crying .

112.content:
Coming to the conclusion that it is your responsibility to defuse any conflict between your disproportionate girlfriend and the local folk, your conscience drags you back towards Lauraine. Of course, you have no idea how receptive Lauraine would be to you. After all, you did kind of stand her up for almost a year. Lauraine may not be clingy, but even she might have taken offense to that.

A mere five feet away from her smoothly topped ankle, you regather your thoughts and turn all of your attention to Lauraine. Nestled between her gargantuan index finger and thumb dangles....what is that? Whatever it is, Lauraine is studying it intently, bringing it inches away from her deep blue eye. Is it...moving? You think it might be squirming. You hear a bone chilling scream from high above. It couldn't be, could it?

Apparently unable to pass Lauraine's examination, she sends the poor, unfortunate soul across the light crimson skyline at an unfathomable velocity with the slightest flick of her wrist. Maybe this wasn't the best idea. Before you can backtrack, however, you are discovered by the titanically terrible love of your life. A vacuum of wind rips your body in every direction and the sky blackens as Lauraine descends upon you. You feel yourself elevating off of the safety of the road. The collar of your shirt weakly strangles you as you are plucked from the ground like a grape from the vine.

Your fear is subsided by your fight to stay conscious during your rapid ascent to...well, you're not really sure what to expect, actually. Odds are, though, that this encounter will be something less than pleasant.

Your trip ends abruptly. You find yourself nose to body with your old flame, though you wouldn't use the terminology to her face (as a matter of fact, your struggling to use any terminology at the moment). You sway with the wind as you are shifted horizontally, greeted at your new destination by a half opened, glimmering blue eye protected by long, tickling lashes. A brief moment of observation leads to the swift revelation of the full orb and a swift eye lash uppercut.

Lauraine addresses you,"...

“Dex, I finally found you".

You’re shocked she recognizes you but something seems off besides Lauraine being huge.
It was as if becoming huge had affected her in unforeseen ways.
She seemed kinder, more forgiving, as in love with you as ever and suddenly air-headed a bit.
You’d been fearing she wouldn’t forgive you but perhaps her newfound air-headed-ness and other changes contributed.


Your fear of forgiveness changes as she held you and spoke.
Tears formed in her eyes.

“I’m so glad I found you Dex! I was so worried when you and everything and everyone shrank all tiny and I stayed the same me”


You were floored! Did Lauraine seriously not realize that is was in fact she that had grown huge?
She continued


“After the whole world shrank, I was lost for a bit then chased away by mean men in tanks and helicopters!
For days they kept being mean and wouldn’t stop. Finally once they gave up I began looking for help or for you Dex.
Even though you’re all tiny now you’re still my cute boyfriend and I’m still yours in body, mind, heart and soul.
It was so hard finding you and I’ve missed you so much.
I miss us having sex.
I miss our movie nights.
I miss our special thing in the bedroom.
No matter how small you are I’m still all yours Dex!
Please forgive me Dex! Please say you’ll take me back! Please say I’m still yours!
I’ll do anything and my body is yours!
I still love you unconditionally”


You were floored and aroused.
She may have become more airheaded but her feelings for you seemed as strong as ever.
She was apparently slightly more submissive which wasn’t necessarily a bad thing given her size.
She wasn’t clingy before but perhaps this was one of the side effects of her size or personality change.
Then again was unconditional love the same as clingy?



You also felt guilty because you were the one who had made Lauraine grow.
Ultimately you know it’s best to keep Lauraine under control and happy.
As a plus you still loved her and you have a giant submissive girlfriend.


In fact a lot of the male population that wasn’t fleeing and were turned on became envious.

“YES LAURAINE YOURE STILL MINE ALWAYS” you shout.

Her tears stop.

“Oh Dex even when you shrink you’re the best guy a girl could ever want”

She brings you to her lips and carefully gives you the biggest kiss ever.

1123.content:
"Wait!", you finally utter a single word.

Lauraine pays you no heed, however. You swing effortlessly towards Lauraine's smiling face with the smallest of pivots from her mighty wrist. Was she enjoying this? No time to worry about that now. Your momentum is quickly shifted away from your tormentor and towards the vast abyss of the clouds. The frightfully soothing breeze skids across your body with a calm harshness. It's rather difficult for you to describe, actually. It makes you feel as though it may be your time to go.

You're violently jerked back into reality. Your shirt begins to rip, but holds strong. Your body once again rests with a weightless stillness in mid-air. A femininely playful giggle erupts from your rear flank. An over the shoulder glance exposes the culprit as, you guessed it, Lauraine, her free hand attempting to muffle the product of your humiliation. Ah yes, you had forgotten that Lauraine was your classic sort of practical joker.

Your shirt gives way and you begin a free fall from grace. At an estimated twenty feet into the drop, however, you land on a peach colored flabby surface covered in small ripples. Before you are four small trees of flesh unified in an inclined manner. It's been a while since you've been able to embrace this sight. Remarkable, really.

"Sorry about that, Jimmy", Lauraine's deeply soft voice apologizes, "I just couldn't help myself". A devilish smile crosses her lips as she continues, "Well look at those tiny little muscles. I'm lucky to have such a big, strong man to protect me".

"Ha ha ha", you reply unenthusiastically, "So, what brings you to the neighborhood, beautiful?".

"I wanted to be on Broadway, but I think I'm in the wrong city", Lauraine answers sarcastically. Upon seeing your serious look, she changes her tune, "I came to see you, silly. You know, you shouldn't have gone so long without visiting. you know how lonely I get. Besides, Janet was really getting on my nerves and..".

"Okay, okay, I get it. I'll look in on you more often", you interrupt, unwilling to remember a few horrible experiences you've had with Lauraine's roommate.

The feeling of nostalgia runs thin as you remember some of the sights you had seen on your journey, "But, what are you doing to the city? To the people?! Lauraine, you can't just treat the city like a playground! You can't through human beings around like trash! I mean, what if you stepped on my paper boy? How would I learn about the rest of the world?".

"Hmmm", Lauraine starts,"...

I thought you were alone all your life?", curious about who she heard it from. " You of course. You're so forgetful, I'll bet you forgot why I like the beach." she says, rolling her eyes.

11232212.content:
"Tired? No, why, whatever, uh, whatever would give you that impression?"

Sand settles beneath you as Lauraine lowers you to the ground. From high above, she smiles. "What else is a girl to think, when her lover bug leaves her in the middle of the night to return to his hive?"

Truth is, you were scared. Your girlfriend, the giantess. If she discovered the one night stand you had...

"Oh, I just need to be around people my own size, that's all."

"Me too. And you haven't met my folks yet, have you?"

You're too confused to offer an opinion before she snatches you up again, pointing with her other hand out to sea. She opens her palm up enough for you to follow, and sight the immense ship approaching the beach, tinier sailboats hurridly making their way out of its path. You wonder why such a vessel would be coming so close to shore; it'll crash, surely!

Then you see that it is just a row-boat, scaled for someone of Lauraine's size. This could be where you finally learn where she came from...

12.content:
Shame fills your heart as you hate yourself for even entertaining the thought of leaving Lauraine alone. She wouldn't run out on you, or at least you would like to think so. She stuck by you when Janet left. She was there when you lost your job. This isn't so different, is it?

You restart your pursuit, hoping Lauraine is kind enough to stay in one place long enough for you to catch up. Lucky for you, she seems to be interested in something on the tenth floor of a thirteen (uh oh, I mean fourteen) story complex. Extending her tender bottom outward as it hovers over a smaller building, Lauraine places her crane-like palms onto her slightly detracted mountain peek-resembling knee caps as she licks her fresh red lips and gazes at the contents of the tenth floor (most of which are likely scattering in a panic).

You find yourself standing eye to ankle with your titanic best friend. You've reached your destination, finally! Now what? There are so many things you want to say. You would like to ask how this happened, or what she was doing downtown, or even if there was something you could do to help. The words, however, all seem to collide with each other within your mouth, clogging your vocal cords. It takes a few minutes, but the right words do finally find their way through the traffic jam in your throat.

"What's up, good looking?", you ask, trying to sound smooth, but coming off as cliche' and corny.

13.content:
Surveying the landscape, a smirk emerges from your lips. Shrieks, shouts, and sirens travel the light crimson air. Plots of concrete, chased by fractured glass, tumble from their structural origins above. The streets form concave patterns, storing the flattened remains of cars, lampposts, mailboxes, and people who were unable to escape Lauraine's footfalls. Perhaps this is why real scientists screen their test subjects before experimentation. It matters little, though. Lauraine can have her fun for the moment. You're not here to clean up her messes.

Of course, if Professor Farnshausen were still around, he would no doubt by in your ear informing you of how irresponsible you were being. Fortunately, the good professor won't be able to bother you ever again. It's hard to believe his demise was captured on television, as Lauraine's overpowering sole transformed the professor from a three dimensional being to a two dimensional one. A sickening sense of glee still fills you each time you recall the scene. That nagging old coot got what he had coming. Now, there was no one alive who had any idea what was going on, save yourself and Lauraine, of course.

Lauraine's rampage continues in full force before you. Your eardrums focus in on a car engine roaring from on high. Lauraine holds the undersized model by its top as its tires desperately attempt escape via a nonexistent highway. Hovering the vehicle in front of her face, Lauraine presents a positively radiant smile to what you can only assume are its passengers. Without warning, the car sweeps across the sky, leaping from rooftop to rooftop.

It's hard for you to judge, but you feel a vibe of playful innocence emit from Lauraine. Could it be possible that she's just a ditz, and not the monster you had thought? You ponder the thought for a moment, but conclude that the answer is irrelevant. Whether Lauraine is victim or villain, she will serve your intentions perfectly. That is, of course, depending on how you approach this situation.

14.content:
When the organization approached you for this job, you really had no idea what you were undertaking or how it would change you like this. It's not like this is the first time you've been sent after one like Lauraine. Hell, you might say you're bored of it by now. Why can't someone else do it the next time another giantess crops up in some other city in the far corner world? Why is it always you?

But hey, at least all your flights are first class and paid for. Now back to business.

"Visual confirmation HQ. Lauraine is still in the city. Not many others though. They're all running like mice." you tap your earpiece and send the call as you steadily pursue the wandering giantess through the maze of skyscrapers. Walking around the footstep craters and crushed cars, shattered glass, raining office papers and spraying fire hydrants you announce, "Her destruction is casual but costly. Maybe it's all some big accident this time. It's like she is lost here. Frightened."

The device powers up as Lauraine spots you , tears that like most her body were at least 27 times normal size were flowing down her face and falling onto the streets below.

Unknown to most of the populace Lauraine was a short 10 year old preteen with barely developing A cup Breasts prior to her change which gave the appearance of 19 what would be C cups on an average sized girl and of course made her a giantess.


Lauraine looked at you making her way towards you desperation, fear and other emotions in her teary eyes. She then noticed the device in your hand aimed at her.

Fear and other emotions growing her last words to you for them moment were:
"Please don't shoot, don't hurt me I just want help I beg you help me please"

And finally charged the beam fired.
Lauraine flinched and braced herself for expected pain as the beam struck her square on the nose but did nothing more than tickle and tingle.

After a few seconds you stop the beam.

At first nothing happens but then....
1442.title: oh oh, it's broken

choices: Tripped and fell killing you and destroying the device but not before you groe
Plucks the device from U attempts 2 shrink but grows and crushes the device
Broke down crying worse than ever before
14422.content:
At first nothing happens but then.... To your horror Lauraine is still huge.

Lauraine notices the feeling is gone and that she had suffered no pain or injuries.

Lauraine was about to make her next move when she felt a different strange feeling. Suddenly for the second time Recently she began to grow evenly in perfect proportions.

150 ft... 200 ... 250
Bigger and bigger she grew towering higher above nearby buildings her bare feet pulverizing things.

"Please stop no more" she pleaded fearful of her growing body to no avail. Her growth continued. 300 ft... 350... 400.. 450

You look over the device as she grows realizing the idiots at the field office gave you a Growth Ray instead of a multi-function size Ray


Finally Lauraine stopped growing at 500 feet tall! In her frightened panic she...
14422.title: Uh Oh Lauraine Growing! Mistake and Disaster!

choices: She began to cry
She continues to seek help
The military arrives and begins their assault
144221.content:
Finally Lauraine stopped growing at 500 feet tall! In her frightened panic she Started to lose her balance then she tripped falling forward.


As she fell forward descending towards you and the building you're on top of you panic forgetting the device you have is a growth Ray and you zap Lauraine again.


As she fell towards you the beam hit her stomach then like before the energy surrounded her. This time however the blast lasted less time as her mid section flattened the building the device and you.

Lauraine landed face first on the ground with a huge thud that created a decent size quake. She also left a crater in the ground in the shape of her body.

"Ouchie" said the 10 year old turned teen Giantess even though she was unhurt.

She lifted her face up but then felt strange again.

"Oh no please don't tell me I'm getting bigger" she said.


Alas the Giantesses wish wash in vain as she started to grow once more.

550... 600... 650
She grew till she was around 720 feet tall

On one hand she was glad the growth stopped and wasn't near as much as the last but still she felt like a giant freak.
144221.title: Tripped and fell killing you and destroying the...

choices: She cries
she is upset with you *gulp*
The military intervenes!
144222.content:
Finally Lauraine stopped growing at 500 feet tall! In her frightened panic she looked around desperately.


She noticed you on the building with the device. She reached for it with 2 fingers and plucked it up.

"W-wait please don't that's not what you think" you try to warn her but your words get tuned out.


"Is this what made me grow? Thank goodness! Please tell me this thing can make me smaller" she said

She shook it a few time before accidentally activating it again. It zapped her in the face at first doing nothing more than tickle her.


Soon she begins to feel strange.
"Yes it's working" she said the beam still firing.

"Please make me smaller! Please make me smaller! Please make me smaller" she chanted and pleaded.

Alas the growth Ray true to its name and design started to make the already 500 foot tall Lauraine start to grow even bigger.

"No please no! Not again! No more" she pleaded to no avail.

In her panic her fingers crushed the device like a grape effectively stopping the beam.

Bigger and bigger she grew till she finally stopped at 800 feet tall!
144222.title: Plucks the device from U attempts 2 shrink but ...

choices: Delayed reaction. Uh Oh Growing Spurts!
Delayed Reaction! Shrinking Spurts! Back to normal
Delayed reaction! Shrinking Spurts! Uh Oh too much Shrinking!
14423.content:
At first nothing happens but then.... Still nothing.

You begin to worry the gun was defective. Meanwhile Lauraine noticed that the feeling had stopped and she herself seemed unharmed.

In fact she felt oddly energized though she was unaware this was the beams energy resonating unseen throughout her entire giant body.

She quickly turned her focus back onto you and took a few more steps towards the building you were still crying and picked you up.

She held you to her face as she spoke.

"Please, I just wanted help and all everyone has done is run from me , treat me like a monster or in your case shoot me! I know I may have wanted to be a little taller and have slightly bigger boobies than my sister but this is overkill! I'm a freak and I'm afraid of hurting people especially friends and family. Please why won't someone help me"


Just as she finished her heartfelt sob filled pleas she began to feel strange and..
14423.title: nothing... Yet

choices: She wants to keep you and the size-ray to herself
She will leave you here on the sidewalk and go home
144232.content: Lauraine noticed that she started to shrink back and stopped crying. She watched as everything grew back to normal until she finally stood on the sidewalk at her normal height. Unfortunately for you she held you in her hand the entire time, shrinking you with her. You were now 7 centimeters tall and in the hand of a 19 year old woman. She suddenly turned her head towards you with a smile on a face and said "You gun-thingy did that, right? Thank you for bringing me back to normal!". It took her a second before she too realized that she was still holding you in her hand. "Oh, I'm sorry, everything happened so quickly that I didn't realize you were shrinking too, I apologize." She thinks for a few seconds before she tells you what she wants to do now.
144232.title: Back to normal

choices: She's talking to him.
She's staring at him menacingly.
She's shaking her fist, as well as its occupant.
She's...tickling him?
Is she putting him in her mouth?!
15.content:
There's no way you can turn a blind eye to the catastrophic event before you. Surely you can do some good. As for the specifics of what that good is, you can't say. However, you'll never know what you could have done unless you go out and actually do it, or at least that's what you keep telling yourself. You can't get rid of the nagging doubt in the back of your mind, though. You don't even know how this woman from the news, this Lauraine, got so big, or even what her intentions are. Really, what good can you do when you're just as clueless as the next guy?

Regardless, you press onward, shutting out physical exhaustion. Lauraine has taken a couple of lengthy steps since your hesitation, but something seems to have caught her attention. Leaving her impossibly long legs perfectly straight, Lauraine bends downward at the torso until her body forms a right angle (approximately, of course). As her derriere pokes at the clouds, Lauraine then proceeds to femininely reach for some unfortunate man desperately trying to evade her grasp, her fingers wiggling in anticipation. It does little good, however, as Lauraine plucks her target in mid-stride.

Entirely engulfed within Lauraine's mighty fist, you can only imagine the terror this stranger must feel as he is forced to ascend. You wonder why this man stuck out. Maybe Lauraine knows him? Perhaps he was chosen at random? In any case, you're pretty sure that whatever Lauraine has in store for him, it wasn't going to be pretty.

You stop your pursuit roughly ten feet away from Lauraine's boulderish heel. It's hard to make out, you can barely make out some of the action 135 feet over head.
15.title: In pursuit of goodness.

choices: On cue the army arrives
Dealing with the media! An explanation and making peace
The tests begin... Wait Lauraine isn’t done growing?!!!
151.content:
It then hits you and you can hear.
She’s talking. Not just talking but her intentions are clearer.


“I finally found you brother. I dunno what caused this but I need help and you’re the smartest person I know”
She was begging the guy apparently her brother for help.


“I-is that really you Lauraine”


“Of course it’s me you nerd! Can’t you recognize your own sister?”


“I-I just can’t believe it tho. You’re huge”


“Hey watch it bro! I’ll have you know I dropped a few pounds@


“I wasn’t talking about weight but tell that to my Jeep under your foot”


She looked down at the blue pancake.


“Uhh ooops! Sorry Tim that’s been happening the last few hours.
It’s so damn hard to navigate this damn city like this”


“Yea I’ll bet”


“Anyway can you please help me bro? I dunno how this happened but if you could help me get back to say 8 or 10 feet tall that would be great”


“Hey why 8 to 10 Feet? You’re only supposed to be 5 ft 2”


“Well besides the fact that you seem to like your bigger sister you perv and I swear all guys are alike, being your sweet little 16 year old sister sucked and although I always wanted to be the tallest girl this is overkill. Anyway if you’re done getting a hard on I’d appreciate the help Tim”


“Well what makes you think I can help? Also do you remember what led up to this?@


“Well for starters you were always into science stuff and while I hate to admit it you always were the smartest out of you, myself, and Lizzie plus Anna is only 5 and you’re the one out of us that’s an adult and college grad with a career in science.
As for what I can remember I was on a date with my boyfriend and...”


“What’s wrong Lauraine?”


“I-I didn’t do it on purpose but I killed Rick and his family”
She began to sob.


“What do you mean you killed them?”


“Well you see I stayed at Rick’s house last night even tho I knew you and mom would flip. Anyway we made out last night. When I woke up this morning there was a bright flash, I blacked back out, when I woke up I was huge like this and ...and Rick’s house was crushed and in shambles... there was nothing left but debris and I realized I must’ve tossed and turned while I was out”


“Yea you used to do that a lot when I was still at home. It’s sounds like this wasn’t your fault tho”


“Of course it was. It was my body and my carelessness and now because of me my boyfriend and his family are dead, their house is destroyed and you’re the 4th person I care about who’s car I crushed”


“I’m not surprised but who else’s car did you flatten?”


“Well obviously Rick’s moms mini van. My friend Kelly’s moms station wagon since they lived next door to Rick,
and Moms spare car from when dad passed away. I took it to Rick’s place but parked a block away unfortunately I was so shocked, surprised and upset over my size and what I’d done so many cars on Maddison Avenue got crushed or damaged by accident”


“Sounds like you had quite the day”


“You dunno the half of it! And these news copters are annoying too”


“Well you might be right to think I can help but first we would need to run some tests.
Also you gotta promise me you’ll at least be careful and mean no harm”


“Of course I mean no harm! I’m not a monster or Godzilla!
Like I said although this is kinda cool it’s not EZ to navigate at this size”


The good samaratin decided now is a good time to get their attention.
He had already started climbing her leg.


“Hey miss Giant down here”

Lauraine notices the Samaritan.
She lifts her leg and grabs him with the same hand her brother is in.


Unfortunately she looses her balance.
She falls backwards on a small mini mart that had been evacuated.


You and Tim are fine and giantess only has a sore rear end.

She hold you both up.

“Sorry about that but what were you thinking stranger? Are you some crazy perv or something”

“I’m sorry. I was listening to your conversation and just wanted to help. Before that I saw you on the news then on the street. I’m a scientist like your brother it seems. I dunno how you got big but I was curious, wanted to help and wanted to know your intentions. The name is Doctor Dale Ricard”



“Oh my goodness the Doctor Ricard? Author of “Making Science Fiction Science Reality” and “Redifining Science As We Know: An In-depth Reimagining” That Doctor Ricard”


“Uhhh Yea... so you’ve heard of me”


“Heard Of you? Are you kidding you’re quite well respected! I can’t believe you’re in our city of all places”


“Well I was kind of working on some stuff off the books and under the radar but it’s nice to meet a fan. Anyway I suspect I could help facilitate some tests on your.. uh... big? Sister and hopefully help with the media frenzy, panic and heaven forbid the army reaction”


“Army? You don’t think they’d really attack me do you?”
151.title: She's talking to him.

choices: Hey, you're 'there', too".
You know, you're right".
Owww, the bastard bit my tongue!".
155.content:
Yes, yes she is. Lauraine's fist pops open, propelling its contents toward wet, waiting lips. The man's stomach slams into the impressionable red bottom lining. The suckers promptly connect, surrounding the unenviable stranger without remorse. Lauraine's index finger draws itself to the man's exposed bottom, slowly forcing his body to slide deeper into the dark confines within her salivating mouth.

Not one to enjoy feeling helpless, you speak up, "Hey! What are you doing? Cut that out!".

What did you just say? You begin to lament your decision to confront the apparently hungry beast. It might not be too late to turn around and run away. Her ears are positioned fairly high. Maybe she didn't even hear you.

"Hmmm?", shatters your hope that you could take back your actions.

Confirming your fears, you look up to find the titaness Lauraine starring back at you. Her legs are spread, and her hands rest upon her hips. Her helpless captive kicks wildly as his legs attempt futilely to pull the rest of his body away from doom. She pays him no attention.

"And why should I listen to you?", Lauraine addresses you in a somewhat prissy tone.

Lauraine's words shoot the stranger out of her mouth. Luckily (or not) for the man, he is able to grip her bottom lip. He hangs helplessly at the whim of his potential devourer. Without taking her eyes off of you, Lauraine's man-sized tongue emerges from the depths of her mouth. The tongue quickly wraps itself around its prey and disappears within the dark hole from whence it came. You think you can make out an imprint of the man on Lauraine's left cheek as he is likely trying to claw his way out. Lauraine's dark smile gives you assurance that this is the case.

Shaking off the horror that just unfolded, you make your case, "Why are you doing this to him?".

"He was there", is Lauraine's only response.

"That isn't a good enough reason to do something like this, is it?", you ask, hoping she agrees.

Lauraine contemplates your words, then speaks, "...
155.title: Interrupting dinner

choices: "Not you again", Lauraine groans.
"He he, I think I have a stalker", Lauraine jokes.
Lauraine ignores you and goes for her food.
1552.content:
"I know plenty of people who do deserve this. I shouldn't be wasting my time on this guy".

The man's image disappears from Lauraine's cheek. Lauraine's lips part as they shoot the stranger out of her mouth and onto the roof of a nearby building comparable to her in height. Lauraine turns her attention back to you.

"Thanks for the idea, tiny", Lauraine says.

With that, Lauraine turns and begins to walk away. You call for her to wait, but she either doesn't hear you, or she has lost interest in you. Each collision between Lauraine's bare sole and the ground shutters through you. It's not so much the power of each step that bothers you (but it is rather intimidating), it is knowing that each stride carries Lauraine to her next victim. A victim you inadvertently have selected. Some good you've done today.

You can't let it end like this. You have to try and stop her again. However, your feet refuse to move much farther. You need another mode of...what's this? A 1999 Dodge Viper, undamaged amongst the chaotic wreckage, with the keys in the ignition and a clear path in Lauraine's direction. Wow, you couldn't write a better scenario (if you could've, shut up. My self-esteem couldn't take it). You jump in the car and take off after Lauraine.

Swerving around Lauraine's deep foot prints proves to be a bit of a challenge, but it's nothing you can't handle. It takes you a solid ten minutes, but you do catch up to Lauraine. Her knees dig into the street, carrying the full weight of Lauraine's body as her upper half stands erect. Before her lays another man, attempting to backpedal from a sitting position. Lauraine licks her lips.

You've made it in time! This man's death will not be on your conscience. You have to convince Lauraine to spare this "deserving" morsel. But first, you have to try something you've always wanted to do. It may not be the appropriate time, but you probably won't get another chance.

At sixty miles per hour, you grip the hand brake and turn the wheel all the way to the right. The Viper spins three times accompanied by smoke and shrieking tires before it comes to a stop next to the potential victim, the nose facing Lauraine. Wow, it really worked. Well, you figured it would either work out this way, or the car would flip and you would die. Needless to say, you are happy with the results.

You jump out of the car and confront Lauraine once again.
1552.title: Guilty conscience

choices: " Good idea, shrimp. I'll eat from there."
" You humans still taste better."
15521.content:
" Not you again." said Lauraine, the man she had in her grasps breaking free and running around a corner, never to be seen again. " Look what you did, you made me lose my lunch." said Lauraine, hands on her hips standing over you and the car.

" You can't eat humans. Its wrong. " said you, hoping your tiny voice could her. " You people eat cows and chickens, me eating humans is the msame thing. And I'm getting hungry." said Lauraine.

She reaches down for you but you get in the car. You start the engine and press down hard on the accelearator but it does not move. " Tough luck pal, your going to be my lunch!" she says.


Lauraine tears open the roof with her hand and rips you from the car, the seatbelt tearing as it tries in vain to keep you down. " Come on ,at least we cows after their dead, we're still alive when you eat us." you tell her. She ignores you and continues to lower you in.

" Wait! I know where you can get food!" you scream. She stops and spreads out her palm so you can stand. " Where ,bug?" she asks. " The supermarket." you reply.
15521.title: "Not you again", Lauraine groans.

choices: She leaves.
She leaves with you!
155211.content:
' " I like your idea little man. Take me there." she says. " Alright, just follow my directions." you tell her. Lauraine steps forward, the earth trembling. She drops the car down, it bursts into flames as it impacts the ground.

" Damn, there goes a really good car." you think to yourself as she carries on. People run underneath in an attempt to get as far away from her as possible. " Look out below!" she yells playfully, stomping on a phone booth. You hear a muffled scream as the booth is crushed into a flat pile of metal.

She arrives at the supermakret, a single storey building. She gets on her knees and puts on the ground . " From her-" your cut off abruptly as she rips open the roof and starts eating all the produce. You swore you saw a cashier get popped into her mouth.

She eats quickly and is done with all the food inside in her belly. " That was tasty. I think I'll eat here more often." said Lauraine.
155211.title: " Good idea, shrimp. I'll eat from ther...

choices: Another Giantess is Coming
The Ground is Opening Up
1552111.content:
As soon as Lauraine is done eating, she lets out a thunderous belch that forces you to cover your ears. You look up and see Lauraine rubbing her mouth as she smirks. "Lucky for you shrimp," she says. "Now I'm too full to eat a human. See ya later." The giantess starts to walk away as you look up and let out a sigh. This disaster was averted, but she would come again. You're lucky that you were able to convince her not to eat humans.

Suddenly you feel vibrations and it isn't just from Lauraine's stomping. You fall back on the ground and that's when the vibrations intensify. As soon as Lorraine is gone, the vibrations worsen and soon you see what's happening.
1552111.title: She leaves.

choices: A giant frightened young girl- help me I Dunno why but I keep growing
A giantess same age as Laurain
A teen or pre teen giantess.
15521111.content:
Another giantess was coming.
This one was slightly larger than Lauraine
15521111.title: Another Giantess is Coming

choices: Preteen
Teen
155211113.content: Okay, this question is simply going to be silly, but do you want a preteen (9 to 12 years old) or do you want a teen (13-17 years old)?
155211113.title: Silly Question

info.brief_description: A different style of giantess interactive story.
info.description:
As opposed to the general style of interactive story, wherein the original author (i.e. me) introduces the characters and their respective story arcs, this work is designed to allow potential authors (i.e. you) to decide these critical story elements for themselves.

As far as rules are concerned, I have no particular preferences. This story is NOT to be limited to my tastes, so please feel free to take this story in whatever direction you desire. My lone request is that you please keep additions within the framework of the story. Pure randomness can quickly kill off what could very well be a great storyline, and I would like to avoid this.

I've said my piece. I hope you enjoy the story.
